section.title: Weld
section.para: Weld can be used to add support for CDI to Servlets, Listeners and Filters. It is easily configured with Jetty 9.

section.title: Weld Setup
section.para: The easiest way to configure weld is within the jetty distribution itself.

listitem.para: Download the weld-servlet artifact and place it into the newly created directory.
You can also download it directly here.
Edit the start.ini file and add an OPTION line for weld near the end.
Continue editting the start.ini file and uncomment the lines for jndi, annotations and plus.
In your webapp's WEB-INF directory create a file called jetty-env.xml with the following contents.

informalexample.programlisting: <!DOCTYPE Configure PUBLIC "-//Jetty//Configure//EN" "http://www.eclipse.org/jetty/configure_9_0.dtd"> <Configure id="webAppCtx" class="org.eclipse.jetty.webapp.WebAppContext"> <New id="BeanManager" class="org.eclipse.jetty.plus.jndi.Resource"> <Arg> <Ref id="webAppCtx"/> </Arg> <Arg>BeanManager</Arg> <Arg> <New class="javax.naming.Reference"> <Arg>javax.enterprise.inject.spi.BeanManager</Arg> <Arg>org.jboss.weld.resources.ManagerObjectFactory</Arg> <Arg/> </New> </Arg> </New> </Configure>
